comments.commentBody:
Oh it's a big deal alright -- a big deal for modestly-off workers, middle or working class, who earn enough to be FINED by ObamaCare, but not enough to buy an overpriced, expensive individual policy from a greedy for-profit insurance company.

When your employer finds out what ObamaCare will cost, they will drop your coverage like a hot rock and pay the fine instead.

Then YOU will not have group coverage. So you will be stuck buying an individual policy on the open market.....for $12,000 a year and up.

What? You can't afford $1000-$1500 a month? TOO BAD! Chief Justice John Roberts sez it is OK, it's just a tax, so now you are fined $4500 a year, but you STILL DO NOT HAVE ANY HEALTH INSURANCE....and your last dime to buy care out-of-pocket is gone, to pay the HUGE FINE.

That's why we are voting Republican, BTW.

I live in a particularly teapartyish corner of Florida, where Obamacare is roughly as popular as mosquitoes. Our state government has so far refused to cooperate in implementing health care reform, so we might have nearly a third of the population remaining uninsured even if Obama's re-elected. But at least half of the states would be moving toward near-universal health insurance.

Ezra Klein today provided a particularly succinct explanation earlier today of the importance of this year's election: health care. The Affordable Care Act is an enormously big deal, far bigger than most policy matters that involve Presidents.

From "dictionary dot reference dot com":

tenace (noun) Whist, Bridge:
A sequence of two high cards of the same suit that lack an intervening card to be in consecutive order, as the ace and queen.

There's also a notion that the Roman Empire was sapped by its rich people making donations to the Christians.  That's apparently discussed in a fresh book: Through the Eye of a Needle: Wealth, the Fall of Rome, and the Making of Christianity in the West, 350-550 AD by Peter Brown (Princeton).
The worst part is that this kind of training now requires that people take out $10k in (gov't subsidized) student loans to pay tuition at a for-profit vocational school.

After the great war with Iran, when our womenfolk are doing the laundry on rocks by the river (if they're not cooking us dinner or having babies) we can fix up the hut with whatever straw, sticks and bricks we can find and whatever tools we have at hand, provided we know how to use them. But whatever you do, don't poach the king's deer, lest he come and blow your house down.

David, my brother in law is a master tool & die maker. He easily earns $150K a year, with zero college. (He did graduate high school.)

It is skilled work, it involves CAD-CAM these days and you must be highly intelligent, and have strong math skills. It is often a union job, with good union benefits.

My brother in law's company is ALWAYS chronically short of workers; they are willing to start workers as apprentices, with real wages and benefits (NOT unpaid internships like in publishing!) and yet, they can't find ANYONE to take these jobs -- none.

They contact all the local colleges and community colleges, but NADA.

Why? the students do not want a "lowly blue collar job" -- no matter that it pays more than most attorney's earn.

They did not go to college to work in factory or machine shop. They want intellectual jobs, working in a office, wearing nice clothing, air conditioning.

So HIGH PAYING JOBS in tool & die (plus many others you mention) go UNFILLED. They can't even get apprentices, who they would TRAIN while paying a SALARY.

Because that is not what young people want to DO. They want to be video game designers.....filmmakers.....editors.....lawyers.....graphic designers.

This is a fact. Meanwhile, many young people are unemployed, or working at Starbucks, while GOOD JOBS WITH BENEFITS are going without takers.

"If you didn’t know what was actually going on in the U.S. economy, you’d think from reading the Obama plan that America was a place where workers with the right skills were in high demand, so that our big problem was that not enough people have those skills."

I think PK, you have been stuck in academia too long. There is a demand for workers with the right skills, but not the kind you speak of. There are skills that do take four years or more to learn and at one time they were taught by a combination of trade schools and apprenticeship programs. However the conservative movement has made union membership hard to come by these days, and that is where these skills were taught.

If you are a skilled industrial electrician, machinist, welder, diesel mechanic, air conditioning technician, finish carpenter, mason, or in any of the skilled trades, there are jobs waiting. In North Dakota there is a shortage of skilled workers on the oil rigs. In Australia diesel mechanics are earning $200K+ in the mines. In Nevada and on the Colorado plateau, there is a shortage of heavy equipment operators.

I can recall a few times when some engineer in the aerospace industry laughed at us when we referred to ourselves as skilled tradesmen, but complained loudly when their power went out.

So you may have a BA, which is not all that difficult to get, but try hooking up the 4160Kv and make that contacter turn on a 1300 ton chiller, and see what that degree does for you.

For someone who used to make sense you've become a dangerous broken record about how voting as a selfish spoiler would make a difference. Every progressive who fails to vote for Obama is a vote for Romney and for shooting oneself in the foot.

Bill, I'm about as left wing as you can get. But I'm afraid you really don't understand the issue regarding Timothy Geithner et all. It is popular by both the Left and the Right to demonize him, Bernanke and Paulson. However, this is an area that I have some understanding. (No I am not a Wall Street Banker) The fact is that all three of these people saved the the entire economy from total and complete collapse.

If people really understood what these guys achieved they would TOTALLY change their mind about what they accomplished. Literally the American Financial System was within days of total and utter collapse. If these guys hadn't been at the helm and steered the financial system through the greatest crisis that has every occurred the world would be an entirely different place. The Depression we would have experienced would have been TEN TIMES WORSE THAN THE GREAT DEPRESSION.

Yes, its true the Federal Reserve (under Greenspan) totally screwed things up. Yes, they were responsible for the policy blunders that caused the crisis. Yes, they did not police the Mortgage Industry (by rights Angelo Mozilo should be serving a 150 year stretch in Leavenworth).

But these guys are true heros. They acted with speed, intelligence and guts to save the system. Eventually history will recognize their great feat.

I strongly recommend Andrew Ross Sorkin's book, "Too Big To Fail". Its a very easy read. And is like a thriller and you will not be able to put down.

So Obama hasn't done everything you want, so you will throw away your vote in protest and allow Mitt Romney the presidency?

Wow. maybe progressives are dumber than rocks.

Obama's hands-off management style, which amounts to being missing in most of the action, is made worse by his decisions to put management into the hands of the wall street criminals. For instance, he chose Timothy Geithner rather than Elizabeth Warren as treasury secretary.

This amounted to putting the fox in charge of guarding the hen house, while sidelining the real defender. Then, as Wall St Journal reporter Ron Suskind details in his fascinating book Confidence Men, Obama stepped back and failed to control Geithner. Anyone who saw the Obama performance in the first debate, where he failed to challenge his rival Romney, would believe the description.

This leads to a management question (I have been a management consultant for a long time, so this is a natural type of thought for me). How do we push the re-elected Obama to do what he should do? Or at least to do what the people who elected him want him to do.

My gesture in this direction is to write in votes for Elizabeth Warren and Sheila Bair, for president and vice president. Here in California, Obama has a substantial lead so this will not throw the election to Romney. But it may start to undermine Obama's smug assumption that we progressives like him, or have nowhere else to go.

Another small step is to give contributions to action groups (e.g. Brady anti gun campaign, NORML for legalizing marijuana), not to Obama.

www.youtube.com/tra1776 especially Progressive Agenda
What a treat for you and Aaron!  Best job in the world with the best sponsor in the world.

Oscar -- Your post does the exact same thing you accuse Romney of; "...offered very little of any substance." And, from your shallow personal attacks of others who disagree with you, I'd say you must be one of the "many low information voters" of whom you speak.

And, you're obviously not very objective either. If I have this all wrong, please do give me all the details of Obama's plan. All I know of his plan is "tax the rich". By now everyone with a lick of sense knows we could tax the rich at 100%, take every dime and it won't but a dent in Obama's spending.

I honestly don't want to support the wrong candidate so help me out with just two of the many problems I have with Obama.

1. Both Bush and Obama added about $5Trillion to national debt, Bush in 8yrs and Obama in less than 4. Think Bush's figure even includes the $0.8Trillion stimulus that Obama demanded go through. Please tell me exactly what you see that I don't that will prevent us from going the way of Greece or Spain with Obama running us up to $20T and/or when interest rates start going up?

2. How can you support a president who sat a watched a 7hr fire-fight with 4 Americans fighting for their lives and did nothing. We had jets 1hr and helos and marines 2hrs. Then obvious deception of American people trying to cover up till after the election. As a spec ops military vet, I'm ill over this and honestly don't see how so many of my fellow Americans can look themselves in the mirror supporting this guy.

Mitt has the highest rated cable news station is his back pocket. I was watching fox last night ( I only hope I'm not dumber than I was yesterday), and all they talk about is Benghazi.

Anyone getting their "news" from fox is getting no news at all.

P.T. Barnum said there's a sucker born every minute, and Romney has used that thesis to hornswoggle the public.  People want to believe what he says although there is no rational reason to believe one word of it.  To quote Shakespeare: What fools these mortals be.

It is mystifying to me that Mitt has been able to snow so many of the voters, especially as he has offered very little of any substance. Sure, there are many low information voters. But there are also many undecideds who read, and think, and care. With any luck, they will vote to re-elect the President. But for those who don't, how do we explain why they are snowed by Mitt?

His five point plan is nothing more than a bunch of meaningless platitudes. Improve training programs (how, exactly?), enforce our trade agreements (how will that improve the economy), offer parents school choice (how and when will that have an impact?), and the oft used tax cuts for "job creators" (why will tax cuts create jobs this time, when they never did during the Bush years?).

How is it that these two men of privilege have convinced so many of those who will be harmed the most by the destruction wrought by their policies to support them? Perhaps it is because those who are the most desperate wish to believe that Mitt and his boy really do possess the fairy dust they will need to achieve all they have promised. Perhaps it is because they don't have the time to become informed, or they lack the education needed to grasp the complexities of tax and economic policy. Perhaps they care only about social issues, and adhere to the dogma of their organized religions. Perhaps they cannot bear the thought of a black man holding the office of President, and anyone else seems better than he.

It is a bad time to loose a comedy icon on Corruption - Jaspal Bhatti, who died in an unfortunate accident yesterday. Even God upstairs is fed up with Corruption news from India, Jaspal must be entertaining and  enlightening HIM with comic skits on corruption.  Some of his ( why most) TV  episodes dealt with corruption - files missing possibly rats were hungry, hospital without medicines and doctors being replaced by Veterinarians during doctor's strike ...

Why are you turning to Twitter? Does the common man of India use Twitter? Has he even heard of Twitter? Does he even have access to electricity, let alone the Internet?

If you want to really do some reporting on what the average person in India thinks about the corruption scandals and accusations, you would be well advised to put leather to dirt and walk around and interview people in slums and villages. That's where the common people of India live.

India's development is hindered not just by endemic corruption but in ability to implement policies for reasons outlined in India Ink yesterday. Corruption  can be minimized by limiting the role of the government in the economy.
If only the judges verdict read like your comment that reeks of poetic justice.

The culture of greed and invulnerability has been dealt a body blow. An Indian sheriff nabbed an orphaned India rogue. History is full of generous and philanthropic bandits including Madoff. He stole from small investors to glorify his benevolent image. It was always about him. Associating with Rajaratnam, a known Wall Street pirate and bank roller of Tamil insurgents was no lapse of judgment but a deliberate endorsement of the faceless piracy. The impeccable reputation of Indian professionals in America has been tarnished. The excellent universities who taught him feel ashamed of the infamous alumnus. Million of Indian youth learnt that their role model is hollow and filled with the same greed that plagues their country. A star has fallen forever and needs to be buried into oblivion. Two years in prison and a dark legacy forever. Was it worth it, Mr Gupta (which means the hidden one)!!

Isn't this the second time he misjudged his accounting abilities. But that doesn't stop him because he can't just retire to Janesville.  He is a representative who has made a terribly large amount of enemies there.   I can't say how I would resolve that because if it indeed happened then it would be suggested that I advocated it.

I'll show you mine if you show me yours. Or, we could look in the mirror and judge for ourselves.

Romney/Ryan, , however, are running for the highest offices of the land that will effect MILLIONS (say, repeal Obama care?) and therefore SHOULD be held to the hightest scrutiny by a free press.

The reporters checking accounts have nothing to do with it other than your projection of blame.
Better yet the question  is Mr. Ryan going to advocate voting rights for fertilized eggs?
This is a really great comment, celli from Boulder. Advertising and the media have sold this modern Cinderella fairy tale/lie, which is why it took hold so well in this country, I think.

MC - I agree, but we must be realistic that we live in a country that put W back in the White House for a 2nd term. I thought it was obvious that he was not prepared for the job the 1st time and it became clearer and clearer over 4 years that he was over his head - but that didn't stop our friends and neighbors from returning him to office.

If Romney is elected it will be clear that we as a nation haven't learned much and really don't vote in our own self interest.

No. So what? Look, most of the basics of government are being squeezed because the federal government is hogging all the resources. State and local governments provide most of the funding for education, roads, law enforcement, justice, and emergency. If you call 911 it won't be federal services coming to your aid. The more the FEDERAL government spends, the less will be available at the state and local level for the basics of government that you're talking about.
Very eloquent. I can't agree with you more. Its hard to believe you are behind the "Orange Curtain" like me. I feel alone in this bastion of Romneyites…

Perhaps it has something to do with the fact that according to a poll earlier this year, over 55% of people who identified themselves as Republican "have always believed President Obama was born in another country," and 63% of them believe *still* that "Iraq had weapons of mass destruction when the US invaded in 2003." Apparently a majority of Republicans are woefully misinformed — and the misinformers are a small cadre of cynical power-grabbers who will lie about anything if that's what it takes to defeat Mr. Obama, and repeat the lies again and again. It's a conscious strategy of deception begun many decades ago and perfected by Karl Rove.

Sometimes things happen to a person that has nothing to do with a lack of personal responsibility, sometimes bad luck or bad genes can bring on hard times. Govt programs are set up for all of us, even the working and apparently well off, because you never know what may be coming around the bend.

This might surprise you, but there are poor people in Oklahoma who receive assistance. Farmers get government help, too. When we are talking abut Ryan's cuts, the biggest known cut (he and Mitt won't list them all) is Medicaid. Millions of elderly in nursing homes, Oklahoma included, are on Medicaid, having been bankrupted and exhausted Medicare coverage. Workers in Oklahoma receive unemployment insurance payments when they lose their jobs. Oklahomans have pre-existing conditions just like everyone else. I could go on, but you get the point.

Good points outlining what Ryan wants to do to "the poor". Though Ryan made a strong attempt a whitewashing his true agenda of decimating the already too meager social safety net. In reality, it's clear Ryan doesn't care about the poor.

Conservatives hate to admit it, our founders included a clause about safeguarding "the general welfare" in the Constitution for a reason. Over many years and in various ways Americans have put this into practice. For example, in cities and towns Americans have chosen to fund fire departments that would protect the rich and poor alike rather than let half a city burn down.
Ayn Rand conservatives who think the disabled and poor receiving Medicaid are "parasites" and "moochers" are the ones who are out of step with American history and values.

We need to strengthen our Social Safety Net, not slash it as Romney and Ryan propose. As I know from first hand experience, an accident or injury (in my case a spinal cord injury) can change all of one's expectations about life. It through such lessons that the "social compact", where we don't let our fellow citizens struggle in poverty and go without basic needs (food, shelter, health insurance), becomes vitally important.

Actually, 1929 signalled The Great Migration(atop open bed railroad cars. Lest there be any confusion perhaps I should have phrased that "flat bed" railway cars). There wasn't really any difference for me to notice until just short of a decade later but I didn't know the difference. Not until I arrived in New Orleans and looking carefully from the courtyard, where we washed our clothes, to the walled but opened yard beyond it where the clothes were hung, I was startled, when I went to take a closer look that there was a resemblence to the galleries and shady under areas where the residents could sit and observe the playground upon which they gazed. The connection of the two points on either end of the railway line was obvious,
'29 was the year my husband's parents arrived and he was born in Chicago. I must say they were not familiar with agricultural labor for the reason that New Orleans was a city of particularized skills learned within an apprentice system that produced skilled craftsmen. It was probably bequeathed to NOLA by Monsieur, younger brother of the King of France and who had a friend with a large plantation just to the North of the View Carre, with whom he played endless card games until his friend lost the plantation lavishly furnished and outfitted by nothing less than craftsmen.
Conservatives never err on the side of generosity or even compassion for those who suffer..
MC: "How can anyone with half a brain not see past these fools and their lies?"   Because they don't want to see past them.
